page.title: 03ATTITUDES IN E. CORNWALL.
page.content: This is a sedate,inward looking people basically conservative in outlook.The adjuncts of modern life had brought a slow change of attitudes, but arrivals of newcomers since 1975 has speeded the process.Friendliness towards these newvomers has cooled as numbers increased,house prices rose,and their more sophisticated views rub of on local youth. Original indifference to many National problems has changed as parents realise the area's new vulnerability. Talks are given on drug abuse,and unaccustomed choices made in education to combat unemployment. Felings of hostility by farmers to the Common Market are evident as produce mountains grow and profits fall.At a time when Britain is not self sufficient in milk,there is anger at milk Quotas which thwart aspirations.
